name: Tribeca Grand Hotel

reviews.text: I was in town overnight for business and chose the Tribeca for it's close proximity to my event. I was most pleasantly surprised by the quality of service and food. Every staff member provided excellent service and always with a smile. Doormen were amazing and so very hospitable. My town car was always there as it was supposed to be, no delays. Room was beautiful, clean and the bed was super cozy and comfy. My most pleasant surprise was the quality of the food as most hotels offered a very starchy, cooked from frozen menu. Each time I ordered room service I was very pleased. LOVED the organics and the gluten-free offerings! Also LOVED that you have Kiehl's in each room as the toiletries. I LOVE Kiehl's and use it at home! Such a nice treat! I have already recommended your hotel to many friends since I have been home. Thanks so much for a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience

reviews.text: I've traveled a lot and this hotel has some of the best customer service I've run across. The front door staff in particular always go out of your way to be helpful. It's also pretty close to Chinatown/Little Italy and only 3 subway stops away from the Brooklyn Bridge (DUMBO area) so that is also very handy.
reviews.title: Best Service at a Hotel

reviews.text: I am in NYC regularly for business. Generally stay in midtown however work took me to TriBeCa and the grand hotel. The hotel is wonderful. The door staff, check in staff , ambience, common areas are all spectacular. A great place to hang out. Room was nicely appointed. So the glitch. I fluffed up the bed for a nap before heading to meetings and there was a very nasty brown smudge on the white duvet. Suffice to say I didn't nap. I went to the front desk and discreetly asked for the duvet to be swapped out. Returning some hours later after dinner exhausted ..... The duvet was still the along w the dirty brown smudges. I slept under the sheet that night.
reviews.title: Would have been 5 star but for one VERY nasty glitch

reviews.text: Aside from the brown issue - genuinely like this hotel a lot. In a great spot w very helpful staff . Also a lovely place to hang out in the lounge.
reviews.title: Ten out of Ten

reviews.text: I will go back but pray not to be confronted by someone's accident again
reviews.title: Pet Friendly in Tribeca!
Wonderful
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights during the NYC Marathon; the hotel is magic, the atmosphere is amazing (you have to love dim-light places) both in the morning - breakfast is super - and at night, when the bar comes to life.

reviews.title: Comfortable, with a sense of style
reviews.text: The rooms are super large and everyone in the staff makes you feel like you've always been at home at the Tribeca.

reviews.title: Great hotel. Great Staff. Great location.
reviews.text: Our next stay in NY will for sure be here once more.

reviews.title: Not so grand
reviews.text: I stayed for a couple of nights on business and was very pleasantly surprised, given some of the reviews on here. The concierge and staff were friendly and helpful, and the service was good. My room was a decent size, and although it was a bit noisy, this is due to the design of the hotel, around an atrium that runs floor to ceiling, so not much that can be done about it. It's well laid out and the design is modern with a bit of character to it, definitely not like being in a faceless corporate hotel. I felt comfortable having a quiet glass of wine on my own in the bar on my return from work, and overall I would recommend it. The location meant I could walk to my meetings, it's close to lots of good bars and restaurants, and the room service is good for those evenings when you aren't eating out. No charge for using the gym either.

reviews.title: Mediocre Room and poor service, not worth the price
reviews.text: This place is fantastic. Was not my first visit here and certainly won't be my last.

Tribeca Grand made it a very pleasant NYC experience for us! The hotel is spotless, the staff is exceptional and the service was excellant. Our girls weekend trip will now be a yearly event and we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else but the Tribeca Grand!
reviews.title: Will definitely go back to Tribeca Grand!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic experience at Tribeca Grand this weekend! We were kind of all over NYC for a wedding and catching up with friends, but had the best location and easy access to everywhere. The bed was super comfortable and the room was perfect. We will stay again and HIGHLY recommend to all!
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel!

reviews.text: Just home from a 4 night stay at the excellent TriBeCa Grand. Location perfect,hotel facilities excellent and staff so efficient helpful and friendly ,especially Allison who checked with us every day to ensure that all was ok after an initial problem. We will be back!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband was staying here for business and i joined him for a long weekend. The hotel was a bit further south than the ones we normally stay in, but this made a refreshing change. The hotel, staff and even the clientel were just that little bit more trendy and it had a lovely local feel to it.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of trendy tribeca

reviews.text: The interior of the hotel is stunning, with an open atrium looking down to the lounge and bar. The room itself was larger than most I've experienced in New York and very well furnished. the hotel had the added bonus of free wi-fi!!
reviews.title: TriBeCa Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in 2 different hotels during this trip to NY and 2 different rooms at the Tribeca Grand. Our first hotel was was in Times Square (YUK!) and were thrilled to move downtown to a hotel and neighborhood with character and charm. Great restaurants, cute boutiques, tree lined streets abound. Tribeca, Soho, Nolita and Little Italy are all just a short walk away. Subway stops a conveniently nearby.
reviews.title: Great location and accomodations with character

reviews.text: The Tribeca Grand is a good sized boutique hotel. Even though we only stayed 2 nights, we received a friendly greeting and felt recognized every time we passed through the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our reason for requiring a change of rooms was handled with true concern and professionalism. Our comfort was their top priority.
reviews.title: Spring 2013 at Tribec Grand

reviews.text: The original Deluxe King room was on the small side but probably pretty average for NYC hotels. Decor is trendy and hip. Beds and linens are of good quality. Street noise was not a problem for us on the 8th floor but the sound of the elevator pully's was distracting to say the least. The room was clean but attention could be paid to the dim lighting.
reviews.title: Funky base for New York adventure

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a Studio King which was much more spacious. This location was extremely quiet. The furnishings in this particular room, although of the same style seemed a bit more worn or weary but equally as clean and comfortable as the last.
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.text: We loved hanging out in the lobby, having a drink and playing pool. It has a very comfortable, fun and inviting atmosphere. Breakfast was very good and the recommendations for navigating the neighborhood were greatly appreciated.
reviews.title: A friendly NYC hotel!
Second visit as good as the first
reviews.text: We love the Tribeca Grand for it's fun location, great atmosphere and especially for the professionalism and friendliness of the excellent staff!!

reviews.title: Excellent and elegant, expensive
reviews.text: There was nary a hitch in our stay. We loved coming back from our busy NYC day to the welcoming lobby. Rarely have we spent so much time hanging out in a hotel lobby. The pool table is a great addition.

reviews.title: Fabulous Place to Stay
reviews.text: It's been 6 months since our last, all too short visit but it was amazing how many staff members remembered us as we entered. Every single person we encountered was friendly and solicitous.

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.text: As long as the price is right, the will be our go-to NYC hotel for our future visits.

reviews.title: Faultless Stay
reviews.text: very good hotel in an excellent location. Friendly and attentive service, elegant building and rooms. Very comfortable, gourmet breakfast. In a word, perfect, except for the price!

reviews.title: The staff makes this place! But loud!
reviews.text: Fantastic staff, everyone I encountered from the doormen to housekeeping to reception were helpful and accommodating. I loved the door men's uniforms - great light blue trousers, very fun and stylish.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first floor of the hotel has great decor, however I wish in the evening there was an actual lobby to wait in, rather than just a loud bar/restaurant/billiards hall. Also, said music is way too loud! The bar music was too loud in the bar to carry a conversation and carried up through the atrium to the rooms. I had to put my own music on to drown out the muffled sounds. At least the DJ has good taste and played great tunes.
reviews.title: Great service Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself disappoints. It seems like it would have been really cool decor maybe 10-15 years ago, but now seems a little dated and shabby. The fabric walk covering was shaggy and worn through in places and the orange armchair had a size able dark stain on the arm. The bathroom was at least interesting. The vanity is covered in a single moulded piece of stainless steel and reminded me a chemistry lab table. Great smelling Malin + Goetz products.
reviews.title: Needs a refurb badly

reviews.text: Would stay again as beds are comfy and location was convenient to my work and family.
reviews.title: NY NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a very enjoyable 8 night stay at this hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff - very attentive. Free WiFi exists throughout the hotel and the mini bar in the room is handy. I would have liked tea and coffee making facilities available in the room but there is a tea/coffee making area on each floor except the 8th floor where we were - minor problem. Hotel is in a very convenient location to Canal Street subway station and is only 5-10 minute walk to the centre of Soho. Also a nice 10-15 minute stroll to Greenwich. In the room we loved the Apple computer, all complimentary, also a nice big TV was great to watch. The room was very spacious for New York hotels at this price range. The hotel is surrounded by great places to eat and drink either straight over the road or around the corner. Hotel staff were very helpful in suggesting places to eat.
reviews.title: Thank you for making our special days grand

reviews.text: I just returned from a five night stay at the Tribeca Grand Hotel. This is the fifth time I have stayed at this wonderful hotel. You can tell it's my favorite place to stay in NYC. You can't beat the location and the subway is so accessible from the hotel. There are many great restaurants in the Tribeca and Soho neighborhoods too. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable. I love the Kiehl's products in the bathroom. The coffee bar located on each floor is such a delight. I love being able to choose a speciality drink such as hot chocolate, mocha, tea, or a coffee throughout the day. It's such a treat! The Church Bar is a fun place to have a drink. The Sunday brunch is back and it was scrumptious. We've missed it the past few summers, so we were thrilled it was back this winter. The jazz band was great and it was fun watching little children dance to the music, while we enjoyed our meal. We were once again given the "GRAND" treatment while guests at the hotel. Thank you to everyone at Tribeca Grand for always making our "girlfriend getaways" to NYC so very special!! Your friends from Nebraska will be back!!
reviews.title: Love the Tribeca Grand!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price (200 bucks for a friday night in tribeca!), it was fantastic--great location, decent-sized room with good lighting and climate control, clean, really quiet, comfortable bed. Had i paid twice as much, i would have been much more critical of little stuff. Like the fact that while the bathroom was adequate and clean, it was not particularly luxe (though i enjoyed the Kiehls products). The shower was chintzy and sprayed water all over the floor).
reviews.title: totally nice

reviews.text: When we needed something, the staff was very responsive. The champagne with check-in was nice as was the free NY Times. We did not use the gym, bar, or restaurant so i can't comment on those.
reviews.title: Amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my boyfriend, his sister and a friend last week! We had an amazing time staying at the Tribeca Grand! We were welcomed with champagne (twice) and had a beautiful room. Small, but for NY standards was it one of the biggest I've seen ;). The music at the churchbar was never a problem and the staff was ever so helpful (especially Carmen!) On each floor there is a coffee/tea/hot chocolat/ice station, you can shoot some pool in the lobby and there is wifi throughout the entire hotel all free of charge!
reviews.title: Cute Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice modern rooms that are pretty small but adequate,Great service but I would avoid the Sunday Brunch. Not much going on at night. The Hotel could use an onsite Restaurant.Concierge was great with setting up off site dining.
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway
Great hotel and location
reviews.text: Cool hotel, within walking distance of really good restaurants and coffee shops. Felt like we were NYC natives not tourists.

reviews.title: Nice place in a nice part of town
reviews.text: Really trendy hotel bar, great cocktails although quiet on sat night, but it was halloween

reviews.title: good location, ok rooms
reviews.text: We had an amazing view from our room.

reviews.title: Stunning service and an oasis in Tribeca
reviews.text: You can walk to Soho for great shopping, walk to West Village for more shopping and walk to East for really cool grungy bars and great food.

reviews.title: Good location but noisy and attention needed in some areas
reviews.text: I would def stay there again

description: Positioned on the border of SoHo and TriBeCa, Tribeca Grand Hotel's location is unrivaled and has long offered guests unparalleled service, stylish accommodations, and exciting nightlife.
